Class PublisherService<T>

java.lang.Object
MyGame.Services.PublisherService<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of argument the callbacks may take
All Implemented Interfaces:
Publisher<T>, Service
Direct Known Subclasses:
Client, Monitor
public abstract class PublisherService<T> extends Object implements Publisher<T>, Service
An abstract implementation of Publisher and Service.

Subscribers for this class are also called "callbacks". The preferred way to attach a callback is via the then(Subscriber) method, which also starts the service if it's not already started and returns itself.

For convenience, callbacks that don't take any argument are also accepted. When publish(T) is called, those will be called without the argument.

See Also:

    • then

      public PublisherService<T> then(Subscriber<T> callback)
      Adds a callback. This will also start the service if it's the first callback.
      Parameters:
      callback - to be called each time the publisher has an update
      Returns:
      itself

    • then

      public final PublisherService<T> then(Runnable callback)
      Adds a parameterless callback. This will also start the service if it's the first callback.

      The callback will be called when publish(T) is called, but with the message discarded.

      Parameters:
      callback - to be called each time the publisher has an update
      Returns:
      itself
